Job description

Geotechnical Principal, Technical Leader - Melbourne, Victoria


\xa0


  • Step into a technical leadership role
  • Your clients come to you for innovative solutions
  • Melbourne, Victoria

\xa0


About the role


We have a passionate and highly experienced team of engineers, geologists and project management consultants working on some of the biggest and most challenging infrastructure projects in Victoria.\xa0 Projects like: Melbourne Metro, Inland rail, Melbourne Olympic Park redevelopment, Caulfield to Dandenong and Cheltenham to Frankston level crossing removal projects and others in the pipeline.\xa0


Our Melbourne business has grown substantially in the past few years and we're looking for the best geotechnical engineers to join our specialist team and be part of our design hub.\xa0 If you feel your career growth has slowed then come to Coffey - there is plenty of room at the top for leaders to grow.\xa0\xa0


\xa0


About you


This position provides technical leadership across Victoria.


You have an enviable reputation for high quality geotechnical work.\xa0 You’re well credentialed and have a broad and in depth understanding of geotechnical engineering.\xa0 You'll have worked in a consulting environment, communicating and liaising directly with clients, managing projects and building the business.\xa0 You're sought after to as a mentor to younger members of the team and your reputation will attract people to Coffey.\xa0 Your work will include all aspects of geotechnical design. \xa0\xa0


If you are looking to work on a broad range of challenging projects, tackle complex problems, design and deliver specialist solutions – with a business that is growing – this\xa0has to be your next\xa0career move.


\xa0


About us

Our talented geoservices and project management specialists collaborate with our project partners and clients to deliver vital national and international projects in transport and property infrastructure; mining and oil and gas.

Since joining Tetra Tech, we’ve combined the resources of a global, multibillion dollar company with Coffey’s reputation and deep expertise in Australia and New Zealand.

It’s a strong combination that’s supporting our growth and creating exciting opportunities.

Coffey believes in equal opportunity.
We care about what makes us different - and it’s our people.
We value our unique backgrounds, experiences and thinking. Our clients do too. They’re the very things that drive collaboration and ingenuity in the solutions we deliver.

If you would like to discuss this opportunity further please call June Roberts on\xa002 9406 1230 or email june.roberts@coffey.com

917935844:
[

Certification Officer

Company Name NZ Transport Agency Company Location Canterbury, AU

New Posted Date Posted 4 hours ago

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Apply your vehicle certification and transport industry experience in a regulatory environment
  • Champion compliance to create a safer network
  • Based in Auckland, Hamilton, Palmerston North, Wellington, Christchurch and Dunedin


About Us


The aim of the Transport Access Delivery group is to provide transport system surety through effective compliance processes, monitoring and management. The Regulatory Compliance group's purpose is to ensure regulated industry participants maintain high levels of compliance in relation to vehicle safety requirements and build a strong safety culture in the vehicles industry.

The Role

The purpose of this role is to ensure compliance with the vehicle certification sector by creating a culture of compliance through education, advice, deterrence and enforcement.

In this role you will be responsible for taking a proactive approach to safety compliance, through auditing industry participants, measuring their performance and taking the appropriate regulatory action where non-compliance is evident.

This is your opportunity to improve standards, systems and apply industry best practice. Drawing on your strong vehicle certification and transport industry experience and your understanding of the Vehicle Inspection Requirement Manuals (VIRM) and backing legislation. We need you to apply current legislation and translate technical meanings into understandable language for providers, resulting in greater compliance.

You Will Bring
  • A proven track record within the vehicle certification and transport industry
  • Working knowledge and understanding of the VIRMs for WoF/CoF
  • Experience in building and sustaining working relationships with the transport and vehicles sector
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Strong skills in Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook, as well as report writing
  • An interest in using regulatory interventions to reduce harm
  • Professional credibility and the ability to relate well to people at all levels
  • The ability to address specific issues and find resolutions within the regulatory guidelines
  • Investigation experience desirable

If you are interested in helping us deliver best practice compliance and enforcement too keep all New Zealanders safe we would love to hear from you.

Applications close: 1 November 2018

For a copy of the position description and to apply: www.nzta.govt.nz/careers

For further information please email: careers@nzta.govt.nz

To be considered for this position you must have a legal right to live and work in New Zealand.

Entry level

  • Government Administration
  • Financial Services

Reporting to the Technical Manager, you will be responsible for effectively conducting quality testing and control of Asphalt Production and Asphalt Laying to ensure all product & quality standards are met and satisfy both internal and external customer requirements in a manner consistent with the laboratory quality system.

  • VCE or Equivalent education level required

  • Demonstrated experience in quality control Testing

What We Offer
  • Highly supportive, team orientated organisation

Early Childhood Educator (Qualified)

Company Name RMIT University Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 23 hours ago Number of views 18 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Early Childhood Educator (Qualified)
Job no: 571144
Work type: Full time - Continuing/Permanent
Categories: Education
  • Convenient CBD location
  • Full time, continuing position
  • $57,960 + super

Our Organisation

RMIT is a global university of technology, design and enterprise. Our mission is to help shape the world through research, innovation, teaching and engagement, and to create transformative experiences for our students, getting them ready for life and work.

The Education Portfolio is headed by the Deputy Vice-Chancellor Education and Vice President who leads the planning and implementation of the University’s strategies related to RMIT’s academic programs and the RMIT student experience. The Portfolio is responsible for services to support the quality of RMIT programs, including the professional development of academic staff, continuous improvement of the student experience, learning and teaching outcomes and the management of learning and research information sources.

The Education Portfolio plays a key role in empowering students to access education, participate actively in the life of the University and achieve successful and fulfilling lives beyond graduation. The provision of a stimulating and satisfying experience for students is a priority for the University.

The Early Childhood Educator Is Responsible For

The Role & Your Responsibilities
  • Providing high quality care to meet the physical, social, emotional and intellectual needs of individuals and groups of children in line with high quality standard of care and the Children’s Services Act 1996, Children’s Services regulations 2011, The National Quality framework (NQF), Early Years Learning Framework (EYLF), Victorian Early Years Learning and Development (VELYLD) and the Centre’s philosophy and mission statement.
  • Undertaking planning, implementing and evaluating developmentally appropriate programs for individuals and groups of children in conjunction with other staff.
  • Building and maintaining close relationships with parents/guardians of the children in the Centre, through constant communication, to meet the needs of individual families.


Skills & Experience Required

As the successful candidate you will have excellent knowledge of the Services regulations 2011, The National Quality framework (NQF), Early Years Learning Framework (EYLF), Victorian Early Years Learning and Development (VELYLD). You will have significant experience in developing and undertaking programme planning and relevant experience in a long day care setting. A thorough knowledge of children’s development and ability to observe, plan, implement and evaluate developmentally appropriate children’s programs is essential to your success in this role. You will demonstrate the ability to work co-operatively and respect families from diverse cultural, socio-economic and religious backgrounds. High level literacy skills are desirable.

Qualifications

Anaphylaxis and asthma training.

A current Level II First Aid Certificate, including CPR.

A Diploma or equivalent (recognised by ACECQA) in Early Childhood Education (minimum qualification).

To Apply

To view a position description, please visit our careers website http://yourcareer.rmit.edu.au or for further information please contact Margaret Crosbie, Early Childhood Coordinator on (03) 9925 8500 quoting job reference # 571144.

PD_Early Childhood Educator Qualified.pdf

Applications close on Friday 26 Oct 2018.

Applicants must separately address the key selection criteria as outlined in the Position Description.

RMIT is an equal opportunity employer committed to being a child safe organisation. We are dedicated to attracting, retaining and developing our people regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability and age. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community and we strongly encourage applications from the Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander community.

Application close: 26 Oct 2018 11:55 PM AUS Eastern Daylight Time

Project Accountant - 9 Month Contract

Company Name Transurban Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 24 hours ago Number of views 24 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • 727 Collins St, Melbourne
  • Fixed Term - 9 months


The more informed we are about what is happening on our roads, and within the corporate functions that support them, the better we can plan for the future. Reporting to the Finance Manager of Technology, the Project Accountant will play a critical role in supporting the Technology department on all financial aspects across a variety of projects and business initiatives. No day will ever be the same in this position and there is never a dull moment when working on the diversity of projects in this department.

At Transurban, the Project Accountant will ultimately manage the operating budget and forecasting process, challenge the business on key assumptions and review all project performance in consultation with project managers.
Our Corporate teams are the backbone of our business. By thinking smarter, sharing better and adapting ahead of the curve, our people here make a meaningful impact – for our customers and our teams. Together, they push further. They define change. And in doing so, they grow their diverse talents while building something to be proud of.

The impact you’ll have-
  • You’ll ensure the projects we deliver in the technology team are financially viable and within budget
  • You’ll engage in monthly results analysis, management reporting, budgeting and forecasting, scenario analysis, business case support and cost analysis
  • You’ll partner with project managers to provide financial support in the identification, shaping and evaluation of new business initiatives and commercial projects
  • You’ll undertake scenario modelling and “what if” analysis and provide financial modelling input into business cases for initiatives
  • You’ll contribute to the success of the Technology Business by identifying new opportunities to reduce cost and benchmarking operational performance through greater transparency and further development of key operational metrics


The talents you’ll bring-
  • Degree qualified in Business, Commerce or Finance, you’ll also have your professional accounting accreditation (CPA or CA).
  • You’ve previously provided financial support to complex project’s within a similar industry
  • You’re naturally analytical and your budgeting and forecasting skills aid your ability to identify and analyse key business drivers. You can clearly identify what should be costed as capex vs opex.
  • You’ll possess high levels of attention to detail, with the accuracy of the information you compile so that your stakeholders can make the right decisions.
  • You’re a team player, but you have no problem working independently to achieve identified goals.
  • Working knowledge of policy related to capitalisation of project expenditure


About Us

Transurban is driven by bringing people and places closer. The roads we plan, build, operate and maintain make communities stronger, across Australia and beyond. Together, we’re building a future that marries traditional infrastructure with emerging technology. We’re making roads ready for driverless cars and predicting accidents before they happen. We’re getting people where they’re going. And we’re doing it faster, smarter and safer, every last one of us.

Start changing the world around you.

Click Apply now.

Job description

  • A Fixed Term\xa0contract role based in Melbourne;
  • Help us create and design our brand new mental health website;
  • Be a significant member of our project team who truly values scaling up and bringing in-house our Mental Health Programmes;
  • Apply your creativity and skills to our commitment of changing the face of men’s health globally.


The Movember\xa0 Foundation is the leading global organisation committed to changing the face of men’s health. Together, we do everything with our values and missions top of mind and these values are at the heart of everything we do;


Fun; We have fun doing good;

Respect; We are caring & inclusive;

Humble; We should never forget why we are here;

Team Movember; We enable every person to be their best;

Remarkable Experience; We create remarkable experiences for our people & community;

Change Agent; We must think & act differently to have an everlasting impact on the face of men’s health.

\xa0

Purpose of this position


We’re looking for a first class contract Visual Designer to join our in-house cross-functional product development team. You’ll work with a team of developers, business analysts and other designers to create inspiring products that will make a meaningful impact on the lives of men around the globe. \xa0


We need somebody who is:\xa0

  • Experienced in User Interface and Visual Design;\xa0
  • Confident and capable of delivering visual design assets that can be built by our developers within a predictable rhythm;\xa0
  • Capable of implementing a design system or design language across multiple platforms;
  • Comfortable and talented with designing prototypes, whilst working with team members to coordinate and provide feedback;\xa0

  • Proficient and adept in delivering design assets that are practical to build and are delivered within an anticipated sequence.

Interested? To be considered for this role you will have:

  • 2+ years experience designing user experiences across a range of different products;\xa0
  • Extensive User Interface and Visual Design experience preparing user interfaces;\xa0
  • Knowledge of technology, design, CX, web and can bring it all together to create a seamless experience;\xa0
  • The ability to translate low fidelity mockups provided by the UX team into high fidelity\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0wireframes;\xa0 \xa0
  • Comprehension and understanding of best practice interaction design;\xa0
  • A great attitude. We need somebody who can work effectively within our Movember team of various disciplines;\xa0
  • Confidence and can operate collaboratively in providing design solutions;\xa0
  • A solid understanding of the agile methodology and ideally have worked within this delivery\xa0 methodology.


How to apply:

We’re keen to see your creative credentials, so please send across your Portflio and a few words about yourself to jobs@movember.com.au\xa0by Monday, 22 October 2018.


Only candidates entitled to work in Australia should apply. (Note: the LinkedIn 'Apply' button only allows one document to be uploaded).\xa0

Job description

There has never been a more exciting time to join Fletcher Building’s Australian Division as we focus on the growth and expansion of our seven Australian businesses and 5,500+ employees. It is the combined power of our 21,000+ employees and 34 businesses worldwide that will help us achieve our business goals and deliver shareholder value. Our immediate opportunity is to re-shape our organisation and create more capacity for innovation, agility and customer connection. Join our team!

About Laminex Australia

We’ve been a part of the iconic Australian design landscape for over 85 years. Only a few short years after Australian’s fell in love with Vegemite, families were spreading their toast in kitchens and on tables made by us. We’ve come a long way.

Today, you’ll see Laminex on surfaces everywhere you look - be it hospitals, shopping centres, restaurants or your home. We manufacture and procure a broad range of products for commercial and residential use such as laminate, engineered stone and veneers so that all Australians can live in beautiful, practical spaces.

The Opportunity

Our newly transformed National Contact Centre in Tullamarine comprises some of our key business functions for both the consumer and the customer.

We are excited to commence the search for a proven and experienced customer champion & people manager in the position of Customer Service Team Leader.

As one of five Team Leaders reporting to the National Contact Centre Manager, the role exists to enable a team of technical Customer Service Representatives deliver outstanding customer service and support to a large and diversified customer base in Australia.

With over 60,000 SKUs in our product range, and a customer base in the thousands, we are a dynamic yet complex business where no two days or queries are the same!

Duties and Responsibilities:

* Hands-on management of a team of 12, enabling effective identification, management and closure of customer queries.
* Mentorship and development of the team on an individual level, empowering them to deliver winning customer solutions independently & autonomously.
* Ownership and project management of complex customer queries, engaging the necessary people within our business to solve them.
* Continually improving what we do and how we do it.

Skills and Experience:

* Proven experience successfully leading a medium to large Customer Service team
* Hands-on experience in a contact centre and customer-facing role
* Effective communication skills and the ability to engage with internal and external stakeholders
* Adaptability and agility, and the ability to respond positively to changing circumstances and market conditions.
* Strong computer literacy with previous experience using Salesforce / Service Cloud systems

In return, you’ll be part of a supportive team, within a dynamic business with leading brands and a strong market position. As part of the Fletcher Building group, you’ll also have access to a host of fantastic staff benefits.

As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we strive to create an inclusive environment for all our employees. We welcome applicants from diverse backgrounds to apply to any of our vacant positions. Talk to us about our flexible working arrangements and career pathways.

Agencies please note: This recruitment assignment is being managed directly by our Fletcher Building Talent Acquisition team. We will certainly reach out to our external partners if we require additional talent options.Your respect for this process is appreciated.

 Our Graduate Recruitment & Development team at the Port Melbourne Support Office is responsible for (a) recruiting early-career Optometrists (predominantly new graduates) to work at in a Specsavers store; and (b) for providing an industry-leading program that supports their professional growth and retention within our business.

Job description

  • Join a leading animal welfare charity that works to prevent cruelty to animals
  • Partner with the organisation to help achieve its strategic and operational goals
  • Permanent full-time opportunity in Burwood East


About the RSPCA Victoria

RSPCA Victoria is a non-government, community-based, not-for-profit organisation whose vision is ‘ending cruelty to all animals’. We are Victoria’s best-known and most respected animal welfare organisation.


Our organisation’s purpose is to work with the community to achieve outstanding animal welfare through education, advocacy, and animal care and protection. RSPCA Victoria’s values – clarity and accountability, respect and consideration, and expertise and collaboration – set clear expectations for all our staff and volunteers.


About the Role


An exciting role has opened up for an experienced Finance Business Partner to join our Financial Services team based in Burwood East.


Reporting to the Finance & Risk Manager and working alongside other business units within the organisation, the successful candidate will play a key role in the organisation’s strategic decision-making process, and will:


  • Partner closely with internal client groups across the business, and develop an understanding of their business drivers and needs to support them in achieving their strategic and operational goals;
  • Provide financial information, analysis, insight and advice to different business units and their leaders, enabling them to make more informed decisions and ensuring they are equipped to make key strategic decisions and achieve objectives aligned to their goals.
  • Support internal client groups across the business through their budgeting, forecasting and business improvement requirements;
  • Prepare financial, management and statutory reports and contribute to the ongoing improvement of business reporting systems;
  • Contribute towards completing financial accounting and balance sheet reconciliation functions with precision and accuracy.
  • Identify, implement and drive opportunities for continuous improvement and risk management within the Financial Services team and across the organisation.


Skills & Experience


The successful candidate will demonstrate the following skills, experience and qualifications:


  • Strong background in a similar strategically focused role, with experience actively partnering with clients within a business to support the implementation of strategic and operational objectives;
  • Highly developed communication skills, with the ability to explain financial details and concepts to different audiences and diverse client groups outside the Financial Services department;
  • The ability to perform as an effective team-player and drive collaboration with other business units;
  • The ability to build strong relationships with client groups and influence and negotiate with various key stakeholders;
  • Strong core finance and technical accounting skills, coupled with the desire to go beyond traditional finance functions and use financial analysis to facilitate change across the business and provide strategic insights;
  • Experience implementing and developing change initiatives and projects;
  • Demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills, with experience developing timely and cost-effective solutions across the business;
  • Possess a drive and enthusiasm to consistently achieve quality results, identify areas of improvement and drive better effectiveness and efficiencies in processes and tasks;
  • Advanced planning and prioritisation skills, with the ability to deliver outcomes within agreed timeframes, resource constraints and competing deadlines in a rapidly changing environment;
  • CA or CPA qualified.


How to apply


Please note, the successful candidate will be required to participate in a national criminal history check as part of the recruitment process.


For more information about this opportunity, please visit the advertisement on our website at www.rspcavic.org and download the position description (top right-hand corner).


Click Apply Online\xa0to submit your application. Please upload your cover letter and resume as one PDF document. Applications close midnight\xa0Monday, 5 November 2018.

[

Tax Advisor/Tax Manager - 12 month FTC

Company Name Carlton & United Breweries Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 3 hours ago Number of views 8 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About CUB

Carlton & United Breweries (CUB) is one of Australia’s most iconic companies. We locally brew some of Australia's most famous beers including Victoria Bitter, Carlton Draught, Pure Blonde, Great Northern, Matilda Bay and ciders including Strongbow, Mercury and Bulmers, as well as distribute some of the world’s leading international brands including Corona, Stella Artois and Budweiser.

Joining CUB, you are opening up a world of career possibilities. We are a part of AB InBev, the largest and only truly global brewer selling over 400 brands across 100 markets and employing 200,000 people. Our Dream is to bring people together for a better world. We are committed to driving growth that leads to better living for more people in more places and focused on bringing people and cultures together through our brands and experiences.

The Role

Reporting to the Associate Director - Tax, you will have responsibility for advising one of the world’s largest companies on a broad range of complex tax issues. Our Tax Team has accountability managing all of the tax compliance and advisory on direct and indirect tax (GST, FBT, WET) obligations for the Australian business unit. You will work closely with members of the Global Tax Team in relation to international tax issues. This is a challenging role with both an advisory and operational elements.

Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to
  • Be up to date with new and proposed legislation and understand the implications for CUB
  • Ensure all files are prepared to a standard for readiness of audit and that all governance processes are adhered to across all taxes
  • Identify and escalate tax risks and/or technical issues in accordance with CUB Tax Risk Management policies
  • Innovating and supporting continuous improvement initiative in tax compliance and process based activities
  • Participate in business projects and initiatives to provide tax advice, support and sign off, when required


Who You Are

This is a challenging role that will suit an experienced Senior Advisor/Manager from a mid to top tier professional services firm (tax or legal), ideally with extensive experience in advising multinationals on tax compliance. Alternatively, you may already be working in the tax function of a large corporation.

You will have a strong desire for continuous improvement and look to potentially streamline standard processes and our ways of working. You will also have the ability to positively interact and influence senior stakeholders. With your analytical mindset and attention to detail, you are not intimidated by complex issues but excited to face a challenge.

To be successful in this role you will have the following skills, experience and attributes
  • Degree qualified (finance, commerce, law), with relevant post-graduate qualification (CA, Masters of Tax, or similar)
  • Exceptional analytical skills for identification of issues with capability in developing technically accurate solutions and delivering insightful analysis
  • Sound project management capability, exceptional time management skills and ability to work to strict deadlines
  • Ability to maintain effective working relationships both internally and externally to achieve results
  • Enjoys and has the ability to work independently as well as part of a team


What We Offer

Learn on the job. Jump in at the deep-end. Dream big!

At CUB, our greatest strength is our people. We recruit people who can be better than ourselves and retain people by allowing them to grow at their own pace, providing training opportunities and offering a safe environment where they will be rewarded for their contributions. To learn more, visit CUB - Our 10 principles.

Join one of the world’s largest consumer packaged goods companies where opportunity awaits.

We do not require a cover letter to be submitted along with your CV. Apply now!

ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY


We are looking for a Senior Business Analyst to establish statement of requirements to streamline and automate business processes to maximise business efficiencies.


The specific focus areas for this program are streamlining, digitising and improving efficiency in the business processes around End to End client engagement and management, finance processes (plan to pay, account receivables, debit collection) and media/digital campaign(s) planning & monitoring automation. These activities range from low-level data processing to high-level interpretation, analysis and client interaction.

Existing business processes have been established over time in a largely manual decentralized processing environment. Our reporting mechanisms and other tools used to evaluate the effectiveness of systems, processes and key work programs are often manual and not well integrated, making it difficult to reconcile and generate real-time insights or statuses.

The aim is to redesign and automate existing business processes that support key programs of work to eliminate inefficiencies in the process. This includes aligning our data and analytics tools and business processes to fit together seamlessly and achieve consistent results. We consider the integration of refined business process with our data analytics and automation program to be the foundation of the new processes.

ABOUT THE ROLE


  • Research and analyse problems, issues and ideas to contribute to the design of practical solutions and processes.
  • Plan, organise and lead the activities of team members/stakeholders, engaged in business, system and/or process design.
  • Engage with stakeholders on unique, complex and/or sensitive issues in order to provide or obtain information on solution requirements and design
  • Apply established methodologies and tools to understand, analyse and document business processes and requirements in line with technical, administrative or overall program constraints
  • Guide discussions that identify approaches to resolve problems while providing input using professional knowledge and experience as well as identify and help develop ideas, analyse alternative courses of action and their implications
  • Document IT Business Process Analysis/Design
  • Work closely with technical solution architect and data architect \xa0to define the E2E solution architecture framework.

\xa0

ABOUT YOU


Skills & Experience\xa0


  • Demonstrated experience successfully delivering end-end business redesign
  • Demonstrated skills and experience undertaking solution design activities, including stakeholder engagement, business analysis and user design
  • Specialized skills/experience in application of LEAN design principles and approaches (or similar) in re-designing business processes
  • Demonstrated experience in knowledge transfer during and on conclusion of the project ensuring availability for future users resulting in reusable documentation of the knowledge
  • Demonstrated experience delivering new/innovative solutions (CRM, P2P or ERP are highly desirable)
  • Demonstrated experience addressing any real or perceived conflicts of interest
  • Specialised skills/experience in undertaking and delivering viable solution designs


Ideally, you will have


  • Outstanding communication and negotiation skills and client focus
  • Exceptional business analysis skills and experience in delivering artefacts to support the development of successful client centered solutions in a team environment
  • A demonstrated commitment to self-development, accountability and skills transfer.
  • Ability to work autonomously and under pressure.
  • Exceptional leadership collaboration and stakeholders engagement skills.


Highly Desirable


  • Experience in media industry



INTERESTED?
\xa0
Great, just send us your CV, a covering letter that highlights why you think you are suitable and anything else that you think we would find interesting – and if we think we would like working together then we will give you a call.

\xa0

“At DAN, a diverse and inclusive culture enables our employees to bring their whole selves to work, and be proud of doing so. \xa0For us, this is the foundation for great innovation which, in turn, generates better outcomes for our people, partners and communities. This is why we encourage applications from people with disabilities, and of all ages, nationalities, backgrounds and cultures”

Senior Internal Auditor

Company Name Australian Unity Company Location Melbourne

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 43 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Located in Albert Road, South Melbourne
  • Relocating to Spring St, CBD in 2019
  • Join us and thrive!

Australian Unity is a national health, wealth and living mutual company providing products and services designed to help people thrive. More than one million Australians have created a brighter future with us. We are a mutual organisation with 280,000 members, more than 7000 employees and generating more than $2 billion in revenues per annum.

Your Role

An exciting opportunity has become available within our Group Audit function for a Senior Internal Auditor.

Reporting directly to the Senior Audit Manager, you will conduct independent reviews, both autonomously and as a team member, covering risk management, control and governance processes. Your primary objective will be to conduct integrated audit reviews, providing constructive working solutions to address control deficiencies and operating inefficiencies.

This position will see you working on a portfolio which will primarily include our Wealth & Capital Markets business and Group Finance & Strategy function.

To be successful in securing this role you will have:

  • A relevant degree coupled with a CA qualification
  • Extensive experience within an audit function (either internal and/or external) and exposure to contemporary audit methodologies and practices
  • Property and / or funds management exposure preferred
  • Excellent verbal communication and stakeholder management skills
  • Well-developed and effective written communication skills including a high standard of business report writing
  • Understanding and application of financial principles and grasp of key business concepts
  • Exposure to data analytics and ITGC would be advantageous
  • The ability to work autonomously and within defined methodologies and timeframes
  • Commitment to continuing professional development

Your work at Australian Unity will be focused on helping others to thrive, and so we seek to create a work environment that supports you to thrive in your career. We operate with commercial principles and with a strong social purpose to create community value.

The culture at Australian Unity is one that truly operates from its values of Bold, Warm and Honest and we are keen to connect as a priority with those who align with this. We also offer a broad range of benefits and incentives.

Join us and thrive!

[

Health, Safety and Wellbeing Business Partner

Company Name RACV Company Location 485 Bourke St, Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

New Posted Date Posted 4 hours ago Number of views 16 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About the Company
RACV is undergoing massive transformation to ensure that we can deliver the best service to our members as possible. We are working on some cool and innovative projects and are looking for someone to join us on this journey. RACV operates in the areas of motoring and other transport, home, leisure and travel, retail (and more) with over 3000 employees across Australia.


About the Role
We’re searching for an experienced Health, Safety and Wellbeing expert to join the team at RACV.\xa0 You will be partnering with leaders across the business to ensure they are able to deliver on the company’s member experience strategy (delivering a great service to our members) by\xa0leading the health, safety and wellbeing activities across the Leisure division. Reporting to the HSW Manager, you will partner with the business to deliver exceptional support across the Leisure portfolio, comprising 8 resorts and 2 clubs nationally.


Your number one focus as the HSW Business Partner - Leisure will be to embed a strong safety culture across RACV, inspiring staff at all levels, from executive chefs, to room attendants, to swim instructors to spa therapists, to live and breathe a safe working philosophy.

About You

You’ll help create and ambassador this proactive behavioural safety culture by:

  • Providing advice and assist in the development, maintenance and implementation of HSW initiatives and programs consistent with RACV strategy, legislative requirements and best practice
  • Assisting with the day-to-day support, advice, training, reporting functions and systems across the Leisure portfolio
  • Attending Sites and participate in OHS team meetings regularly
  • Continually reviewing work practices and recommend ways in which processes and systems can be improved
  • Supporting sites to undertake risk assessments of new or changed plant, chemicals, facilities etc
  • Participating in relevant industry bodies, internal HSW forums etc. to maintain a level of knowledge and best practice approaches
  • Assisting the HSW team in conducting routine site inspections and audits, identifying any hazards, establishing appropriate control measures and provide recommendations to all stakeholders
  • Keeping abreast of legislative changes and ensure these are considered when monitoring the implementation of the OHS Management System
  • Participating in the review, development and maintenance of OHS policy, procedures and guidelines to ensure consistency and that SOP’s are implemented across RACV to support the operations of the team, especially relating to the OHS Management System
  • Assisting in the development and delivery of face-to-face and on-line OHS training
  • Leading and facilitating investigations with site management to ensure the root causes and corrective actions are identified
  • Developing Safety Alerts in consultation with Line Managers to communicate relevant learnings and actions to other parts of the business
  • Liaising with injured employees and their managers to ensure early intervention injury management processes are implemented
  • Compiling HSW data for monthly, quarterly and ad-hoc reporting as required
  • Assisting in the development of annual divisional safety improvement plans
  • Supporting the HSW team to maintain RACV self-insurance status.


This is an exciting career development opportunity for a confident change agent who wants to help build the HSW function from the ground up, influencing strategy and vision organisation wide. Relationship building and stakeholder management will be the foundation of your success in this role, along with a high level of personal initiative, decisive nature and a passion for people safety. Along with demonstrated professional experience, you’ll possess OH&S qualifications, and a thorough working knowledge of OH&S legislation and WorkCover. Strong business acumen, attention to detail and influencing skills are fundamental to this role, as are highly developed interpersonal skills and resilience.\xa0

\xa0\xa0

So why join our team?

We are a passionate team that work hard and know how to have fun. We all are committed to delivering a positive member experience in everything we do.


Are you interested? Or perhaps you know someone who might be? Then we’d love to hear from you.

\xa0

Please note, Recruitment Agency submissions will not be accepted at this stage
